clusters.title: A landslide victory in a lacklustre election that wounds the Irish government
clusters.neutral_headline: Catherine Connolly wins Irish presidential election in landslide

items.title: A landslide victory in a lacklustre election that wounds the Irish government
items.standfirst: In a result that was never in doubt, Catherine Connolly will become Ireland's 10th president, with an overwhelming victory.
items.content: In a result that was never in doubt, Catherine Connolly will become Ireland's 10th president, with an overwhelming victory.

items.title: Catherine Connolly’s landslide shakes Ireland’s establishment – but not its politics
items.standfirst: Connolly’s stunning victory humbles old parties and energises the left, yet it’s no revolution: the presidency remains symbolicCatherine Connolly’s landslide victory in Ireland’s presidential election is a stunning political feat that humiliates the establishment but does not signify a national swerve to the left.There was nothing inevitable about her triumph, let alone its scale. In July, when she declared her candidacy, she was a one-woman act: an independent leftwing member of parliament from Galway who was unfamiliar to most voters. Continue reading...
items.content: Connolly’s stunning victory humbles old parties and energises the left, yet it’s no revolution: the presidency remains symbolicCatherine Connolly’s landslide victory in Ireland’s presidential election is a stunning political feat that humiliates the establishment but does not signify a national swerve to the left.There was nothing inevitable about her triumph, let alone its scale. In July, when she declared her candidacy, she was a one-woman act: an independent leftwing member of parliament from Galway who was unfamiliar to most voters. Continue reading...

items.title: Ireland elects hard-left EU critic Catherine Connolly as next president
items.standfirst: Early results from Ireland’s presidential election point to a clear victory for independent Catherine Connolly, a staunch defender of military neutrality and outspoken critic of EU policy. Connolly, a 68-year-old barrister and member of Ireland’s parliament since 2016, is far ahead of her…
items.content: Early results from Ireland’s presidential election point to a clear victory for independent Catherine Connolly, a staunch defender of military neutrality and outspoken critic of EU policy. Connolly, a 68-year-old barrister and member of Ireland’s parliament since 2016, is far ahead of her…

items.title: Connolly wins Ireland’s presidential election in landslide
items.standfirst: Catherine Connolly, a pro-Palestine, left-wing candidate, secures 63 percent of the vote to defeat centre-right rival.
items.content: Catherine Connolly, a pro-Palestine, left-wing candidate, secures 63 percent of the vote to defeat centre-right rival.

items.title: Ireland's Catherine Connolly set to be president after rival concedes election
items.standfirst: Connolly has garnered the backing of a range of left-leaning parties, including Sinn Féin, the Labour Party and the Social Democrats.
items.content: Connolly has garnered the backing of a range of left-leaning parties, including Sinn Féin, the Labour Party and the Social Democrats.

items.standfirst: Catherine Connolly triumphs in contest marked by significant number of spoilt ballots
items.content: Catherine Connolly triumphs in contest marked by significant number of spoilt ballots

items.title: Ireland's left-wing independent Connolly wins presidential election in landslide
items.standfirst: Left-wing independent Catherine Connolly is set to become Ireland's new president after winning a landslide victory on Saturday, beating her centrist rival Heather Humphreys with more that 63 percent of the ballots.
items.content: Left-wing independent Catherine Connolly is set to become Ireland's new president after winning a landslide victory on Saturday, beating her centrist rival Heather Humphreys with more that 63 percent of the ballots.

items.title: Hard-left candidate secures landslide in Irish presidential election

items.content: Catherine Connolly triumphs in contest marked by significant number of spoilt ballots

items.title: Leftwinger Catherine Connolly wins Ireland presidential election by landslide
items.standfirst: Heather Humphreys concedes defeat after early vote tallies show insurmountable gap between candidatesThe leftwing independent candidate, Catherine Connolly, has won a landslide victory in Ireland’s presidential election.Her rival, Heather Humphreys, conceded defeat on Saturday afternoon after early vote tallies showed an insurmountable gap between the candidates. Continue reading...
items.content: Heather Humphreys concedes defeat after early vote tallies show insurmountable gap between candidatesThe leftwing independent candidate, Catherine Connolly, has won a landslide victory in Ireland’s presidential election.Her rival, Heather Humphreys, conceded defeat on Saturday afternoon after early vote tallies showed an insurmountable gap between the candidates. Continue reading...

items.title: Independent candidate Catherine Connolly wins Irish presidential election
items.standfirst: Independent candidate Catherine Connolly has become Ireland's next president after her rival conceded.
items.content: Independent candidate Catherine Connolly has become Ireland's next president after her rival conceded.

items.title: Who is Catherine Connolly, Ireland's next president?
items.standfirst: Veteran independent lawmaker Catherine Connolly is set to be Ireland's new president after Fine Gael's Heather Humphreys conceded in the election.
items.content: Veteran independent lawmaker Catherine Connolly is set to be Ireland's new president after Fine Gael's Heather Humphreys conceded in the election.

ai_summary: Catherine Connolly, an independent, won the Irish presidential election with a large margin.
She secured 63 percent of the vote, defeating her center-right rival.
Connolly is a staunch defender of military neutrality and critic of EU policy.
The victory was marked by a significant number of spoilt ballots.
Connolly has support from left-leaning parties like Sinn Féin and the Labour Party.

Harris's comments came despite lagging poll numbers.

clusters.title: Ontario premier’s Reagan ad rekindles tensions with Trump
clusters.neutral_headline: Canada pulls Reagan ad after Trump halts trade talks

items.title: Ontario premier’s Reagan ad rekindles tensions with Trump
items.standfirst: The premier of Canada’s mostpopulous province has again complicated the country’s delicate trade negotiations with the US, this time with a political ad targeting Americans that has drawn the ire of US President Donald Trump. The ad, commissioned by Doug Ford, Ontario's outspoken Conservative premier who is sometimes compared to Trump, uses a snippet of Republican icon and former President Ronald Reagan saying that tariffs cause trade wars and economic disaster.
items.content: The premier of Canada’s mostpopulous province has again complicated the country’s delicate trade negotiations with the US, this time with a political ad targeting Americans that has drawn the ire of US President Donald Trump. The ad, commissioned by Doug Ford, Ontario's outspoken Conservative premier who is sometimes compared to Trump, uses a snippet of Republican icon and former President Ronald Reagan saying that tariffs cause trade wars and economic disaster.

items.title: Canadians pull Reagan advertisement after furious Trump halts trade talks
items.standfirst: Ontario to stop running advertisement featuring voice of US President Ronald Reagan saying that trade tariffs were a bad idea.
items.content: Ontario to stop running advertisement featuring voice of US President Ronald Reagan saying that trade tariffs were a bad idea.

items.title: Canada to pull tariff ad featuring Reagan
items.standfirst: Canada announced it will stop airing an ad featuring former President Reagan criticizing tariffs, after President Trump said he would cut off trade talks over the ad. NBC News’ Kelly O’Donnell reports.
items.content: Canada announced it will stop airing an ad featuring former President Reagan criticizing tariffs, after President Trump said he would cut off trade talks over the ad. NBC News’ Kelly O’Donnell reports.

items.title: US and Canada spar over ad of Reagan denouncing tariffs that led to derailed trade talks
items.standfirst: Ontario premier says he plans to run ad featuring speech that sparked Trump’s ire again during World Series but campaign will end MondayAfter the US suspended all trade negotiations with Canada over a 1987 speech by Ronald Reagan denouncing tariffs that appeared to spark Donald Trump’s ire, the premier of Ontario said he planned to run an ad featuring the speech again during the World Series on Friday.Doug Ford, whose government ran the Reagan ad in US markets this week, first posted on X that the two nations were “stronger together”, while Trump added his own string of social media posts trumpeting the supposed benefits of tariffs. Continue reading...
items.content: Ontario premier says he plans to run ad featuring speech that sparked Trump’s ire again during World Series but campaign will end MondayAfter the US suspended all trade negotiations with Canada over a 1987 speech by Ronald Reagan denouncing tariffs that appeared to spark Donald Trump’s ire, the premier of Ontario said he planned to run an ad featuring the speech again during the World Series on Friday.Doug Ford, whose government ran the Reagan ad in US markets this week, first posted on X that the two nations were “stronger together”, while Trump added his own string of social media posts trumpeting the supposed benefits of tariffs. Continue reading...

items.title: Trump says all Canada trade talks ‘terminated’ over ad criticising tariffs
items.standfirst: US president accuses Canada of ‘egregious behaviour’ after release of ad featuring Ronald Reagan criticising tariffsUS politics – live updatesDonald Trump has announced an immediate end to “all trade negotiations” with Canada over a television advertisement opposing US tariffs that quoted the former US president Ronald Reagan.The ad, which was paid for by the government of the Canadian province of Ontario, uses excerpts of a 1987 speech where Reagan says “trade barriers hurt every American worker”. Continue reading...
items.content: US president accuses Canada of ‘egregious behaviour’ after release of ad featuring Ronald Reagan criticising tariffsUS politics – live updatesDonald Trump has announced an immediate end to “all trade negotiations” with Canada over a television advertisement opposing US tariffs that quoted the former US president Ronald Reagan.The ad, which was paid for by the government of the Canadian province of Ontario, uses excerpts of a 1987 speech where Reagan says “trade barriers hurt every American worker”. Continue reading...

ai_summary: Ontario will stop running an ad featuring Ronald Reagan criticizing tariffs.
The ad's content led to the US suspending trade negotiations with Canada.
The ad was commissioned by Ontario's premier, Doug Ford.
Trump accused Canada of "egregious behaviour" over the ad.
The US and Canada are now in a trade dispute over the ad.

clusters.title: Trump heads to Asia with trade — and tensions with Xi — on the agenda
clusters.neutral_headline: Trump heads to Asia for trade talks with China's Xi

items.title: Trump heads to Asia with trade — and tensions with Xi — on the agenda
items.standfirst: KUALA LUMPUR, Malaysia — President Donald Trump arrives in Southeast Asia on Sunday for his first visit to the continent since returning to office, a three-nation tour through Malaysia, Japan and South Korea that is expected to culminate in a meeting with Chinese President Xi Jinping, as tensions between the world’s two biggest economies tick higher.“The first message is Trump the peacemaker.
items.content: KUALA LUMPUR, Malaysia — President Donald Trump arrives in Southeast Asia on Sunday for his first visit to the continent since returning to office, a three-nation tour through Malaysia, Japan and South Korea that is expected to culminate in a meeting with Chinese President Xi Jinping, as tensions between the world’s two biggest economies tick higher.“The first message is Trump the peacemaker.

items.title: Trump heads to Asia for talks with China's Xi amid trade tensions
items.standfirst: US President Donald Trump on Saturday headed for Asia and high-stakes trade talks with Chinese counterpart Xi Jinping, saying that he would also like to meet North Korean leader Kim Jong Un on his trip. FRANCE 24 speaks to Robert Manning, Distinguished Fellow with the Strategic Foresight Hub and the China Program at the Stimson Center, to discuss what might be on the agenda.
items.content: US President Donald Trump on Saturday headed for Asia and high-stakes trade talks with Chinese counterpart Xi Jinping, saying that he would also like to meet North Korean leader Kim Jong Un on his trip. FRANCE 24 speaks to Robert Manning, Distinguished Fellow with the Strategic Foresight Hub and the China Program at the Stimson Center, to discuss what might be on the agenda.

items.title: Trump says he is open to meeting Kim Jong-un as he embarks on whirlwind Asia tour
items.standfirst: Trip will see him take part in high-stakes trade talks with Chinese leader Xi Jinping – but he also raised prospect of meeting North Korean leaderTrump in Asia: five key questions as US president prepares for diplomatic tourDonald Trump has set off for a tour of Asia where he is expected to take part in high-stakes trade talks with China’s leader, Xi Jinping – telling reporters he was also open to a meeting with the North Korean leader, Kim Jong-un.Trump, who left Washington on Friday night, is set for a five-day trip to Malaysia, Japan and South Korea, his first visit to the region since taking office in January. He is due to arrive in Malaysia on Sunday morning local time. Continue reading...
items.content: Trip will see him take part in high-stakes trade talks with Chinese leader Xi Jinping – but he also raised prospect of meeting North Korean leaderTrump in Asia: five key questions as US president prepares for diplomatic tourDonald Trump has set off for a tour of Asia where he is expected to take part in high-stakes trade talks with China’s leader, Xi Jinping – telling reporters he was also open to a meeting with the North Korean leader, Kim Jong-un.Trump, who left Washington on Friday night, is set for a five-day trip to Malaysia, Japan and South Korea, his first visit to the region since taking office in January. He is due to arrive in Malaysia on Sunday morning local time. Continue reading...

items.title: Trade tensions hang over Trump's Asia trip, but he still aims to make a deal
items.standfirst: President Trump plans to attend a summit in Malaysia before meeting the new Japanese prime minister in Tokyo and talking to Chinese President Xi Jinping in Korea.
items.content: President Trump plans to attend a summit in Malaysia before meeting the new Japanese prime minister in Tokyo and talking to Chinese President Xi Jinping in Korea. (Image credit: Yoan Valat/Pool)

ai_summary: Donald Trump is in Asia for trade talks with Chinese President Xi Jinping.
He is also open to meeting with North Korean leader Kim Jong Un.
The trip includes stops in Malaysia, Japan, and South Korea.
Trade tensions between the US and China are high.
This is Trump's first visit to the region since taking office.

items.title: Billionaire Who Gave $130M to Military During Shutdown Identified—Report
items.standfirst: The wealthy donor who gave $130 million to the Pentagon during the government shutdown has reportedly been identified.
items.content: The wealthy donor who gave $130 million to the Pentagon during the government shutdown has reportedly been identified.

items.title: Trump backer Timothy Mellon identified as donor of $130m for US troop pay during government shutdown
items.standfirst: Reclusive Republican billionaire is descendant of gilded age industrialist and former treasury secretary Andrew MellonA reclusive billionaire, anti-tax crusader and major financial backer of Donald Trump has been named as the anonymous private donor who gave $130m to the government to help pay US troops during the federal shutdown that is now in its fourth week, according to the New York Times.Timothy Mellon, heir to the gilded age industrialist and former treasury secretary Andrew Mellon, is the secret donor whom Trump has described as a “friend”, “great American” and “patriot”, but has refused to name, the Times reported on Saturday, citing two anonymous sources familiar with the arrangement. Continue reading...

Continue reading...

items.title: Japanese tourist dies in fall from Pantheon in Rome
items.standfirst: The 69-year-old man plunged 7 metres from an outer wall after becoming unwell and losing his balanceA Japanese tourist has died after falling from the outer wall of the Pantheon in Rome.The man, 69, had been sitting on the wall before he plunged 7 metres into the ancient landmark’s moat on Friday night, the Italian news agency, Ansa, reported. Continue reading...

clusters.title: French court sentences Algerian woman to life for murdering schoolgirl
clusters.neutral_headline: French Court Sentences Algerian Woman to Life Imprisonment

items.title: French court sentences Algerian woman to life for murdering schoolgirl
items.standfirst: A French court on Friday sentenced an Algerian woman to life imprisonment without parole for raping, torturing and murdering a schoolgirl in Paris, making her the first woman to receive this maximum sentence. Dahbia Benkired was handed an "irreducible life sentence" for killing 12-year-old Lola Daviet in the French capital in 2022, in a case that horrified the country and sparked anti-immigration fervour because the woman did not have the right to be in France.
items.content: A French court on Friday sentenced an Algerian woman to life imprisonment without parole for raping, torturing and murdering a schoolgirl in Paris, making her the first woman to receive this maximum sentence. Dahbia Benkired was handed an "irreducible life sentence" for killing 12-year-old Lola Daviet in the French capital in 2022, in a case that horrified the country and sparked anti-immigration fervour because the woman did not have the right to be in France.

items.title: Woman gets rare whole-life sentence for murder of French schoolgirl
items.standfirst: Dahbia Benkired is the first woman in France to receive a full life term following the shocking crime.
items.content: Dahbia Benkired is the first woman in France to receive a full life term following the shocking crime.

ai_summary: A French court sentenced an Algerian woman to life imprisonment without parole.
She was convicted of raping, torturing, and murdering a schoolgirl.
The crime occurred in Paris, shocking the nation.
The woman is the first to receive this maximum sentence in France.
The case sparked anti-immigration sentiment due to her legal status.

items.title: US imposes sanctions on left-wing Colombian President Petro
items.standfirst: Washington has accused Gustavo Petro of allowing drug cartels to flourish during his time in office.
items.content: Washington has accused Gustavo Petro of allowing drug cartels to flourish during his time in office.

items.title: US places sanctions on Colombian president over alleged failure to stop cartels
items.standfirst: Treasury accuses Gustavo Petro of ‘allowing drug cartels to flourish’ as president attacks Trump’s ‘oppressive regime’The US treasury department has announced sanctions on Colombian president Gustavo Petro, one of Donald Trump’s harshest international critics.“President Petro has allowed drug cartels to flourish and refused to stop this activity,” treasury secretary Scott Bessent wrote in a post on X. “Today President Trump is taking strong action to protect our nation.” Continue reading...
items.content: Treasury accuses Gustavo Petro of ‘allowing drug cartels to flourish’ as president attacks Trump’s ‘oppressive regime’The US treasury department has announced sanctions on Colombian president Gustavo Petro, one of Donald Trump’s harshest international critics.“President Petro has allowed drug cartels to flourish and refused to stop this activity,” treasury secretary Scott Bessent wrote in a post on X. “Today President Trump is taking strong action to protect our nation.” Continue reading...

ai_summary: The United States imposed sanctions on Colombian President Gustavo Petro.
The US Treasury accused Petro of allowing drug cartels to flourish.
The sanctions were announced by the US Treasury Department.
President Trump's administration is taking action.
Petro has been a vocal critic of Trump's policies.
